documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary (Section 1.3) to Section 8 for details on procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 (Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive features of the study design.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 (Table 4) to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria for Blood Donation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.2 regarding the exclusion criterion for blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Methods Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for descriptions of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria for Contraception
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.1 for start times for contraceptives.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the SoA for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 as a reason for discontinuation from study intervention.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the SoA (Table 1) for samples and data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 (Electrocardiograms) to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests List
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, follow-up, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Non-use Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 stating that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing, as detailed in Section 8.7.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details of molybdenum measured in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details of specific biomarkers like total copper, PUF-copper, and ceruloplasmin.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets used for analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8

commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23) may be extended up to an additional 14 days... Limit: Not >14 days
Participants may be checked in on Day 22 rather than Day 23 at the Investigator discretion. Limit: Check-in to clinical research unit allowed 1 day prior
Dose range limit 15 mg every other day to 30 mg/day

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clarify study procedures in the US to facilitate participant recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.
